summary: The NOAA Weather Radio Modernization Act aims to improve the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) weather radio system. It mandates the expansion and modernization of NOAA Weather Radio, including improved coverage, reliability, and the ability to disseminate alerts effectively. The bill also directs the development of national standards for weather warning systems in flash flood zones and addresses employee classification and staffing plans within NOAA to protect against hiring freezes. Furthermore, the bill allocates funding for these modernization and operational efforts.
